alert.note: Alert for Boone; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Raleigh, north central Wyoming and southeastern Boone Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 556 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms 9 miles northeast of Oceana, or 12 miles north of Pineville, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bald Knob, Naoma, Kopperston and Stickney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
